procedure.title: Meath Co Co - MH-TRA-24-04 - Ratoath Pedestrian and Cycle Scheme
procedure.description:
**Title: Meath Co Co - MH-TRA-24-04 - Ratoath Pedestrian and Cycle Scheme**

**Description:**
The Meath County Council is seeking proposals for the Ratoath Pedestrian and Cycle Scheme, a comprehensive upgrade of pedestrian and cycle facilities in Ratoath. The project aims to enhance the safety and accessibility of the area by incorporating upgraded pedestrian and cyclist infrastructure, including:

- **Pedestrian Facilities:** Improvements to sidewalks, pedestrian crossings, and accessible pathways.
- **Cycle Facilities:** Upgrades to cycle lanes, bike paths, and secure bike parking areas.
- **Traffic Management Measures:** Implementation of traffic calming measures, such as speed bumps and traffic signals, to ensure safe movement of both pedestrians and cyclists.
- **Traffic Signals:** Installation of new or upgraded traffic signals to manage traffic flow effectively.
- **Public Lighting:** Enhancement of public lighting to improve visibility and safety at night.
- **Utilities:** Integration of necessary utilities to support the upgraded infrastructure, including drainage and signage.

The successful bidder will be responsible for designing, procuring, and implementing these improvements while ensuring compliance with all relevant local and national regulations. The project will contribute to the development of sustainable and inclusive transportation systems in Ratoath, aligning with Meath County Council's commitment to enhancing community infrastructure and promoting active transportation.
